# Analysis of Discord Chat in "ðŸ’»â”‚developers" Channel

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily revolves around Hyperfy development, focusing on performance optimization, app development, and upcoming features. Ashxn introduced a new performance tracking tool that displays metrics like instances, geometries, triangles, and texture memory, helping developers identify optimization opportunities. Several developers worked on creating mountable objects like bikes, with discussions about player control APIs and teleportation. There were technical conversations about draw calls, materials, and mesh optimization, with Ashxn demonstrating significant performance improvements in the play world (reducing CPU usage from 20ms to 6ms and GPU usage from 50ms to 38ms). Developers also discussed potential features like multi-script apps, a compass/navigation system, and combat functionality. Saori mentioned a strategic shift toward focusing on features that would attract new users rather than solely addressing existing builder requests, with combat being identified as a high-demand feature from users and gamers.

## 2. FAQ

Q: How to set collision on Hyperfy V2? (asked by OttisOts) A: Go into blender, open addons panel search for hyperfy, it handles it for you. (answered by Saori)
Q: Is there any way we could expose the default avi so we can make apps to access it? (asked by MetaRick) A: Unanswered
Q: Is there a way to read how long an animation is from the .glb? (asked by peezy) A: You could use blender or use a Cursor marketplace extension (https://marketplace.cursorapi.com/items?itemName=degreat.3e). (answered by á²¼)

# Analysis of âš¡â”‚general Discord Chat

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around Hyperfy V2 development, documentation, and community building. Key technical discussions include the transition from V1 to V2, with mentions of internationalization (i18n) being added to hyperfy.how. There was discussion about server issues causing random disconnects due to a 60-second idle timeout. Community members shared insights about metaverse design philosophy, challenging traditional spatial constraints in virtual environments. Documentation organization was discussed, with hyperfy.how being identified as the central resource. Development workflow was explained - features are built on the dev branch and pushed to main once stable. Controller support for PlayStation 5 was demonstrated working on Solana Mobile. The chat also touched on VR interaction capabilities and performance issues in larger worlds.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Where do you recommend me to start as a new user? (asked by MeryShark) A: Go to play.hyperfy.xyz, then follow hyperfy.how/quickstart, grab community assets, and download .hyp apps (answered by Omka)
Q: What OS should I use for my first VPS to host Hyperfy2? (asked by tunelight) A: You shouldn't need to use cloud panel, check the VPS setup guide (answered by maximus)
Q: How is Hyperfy evolving in terms of development workflow? (asked by MetaDoge) A: Features are built on dev branch and pushed to main when stable, with no formal sprint structure (answered by Ashxn and Saori)
Q: Is all documentation about Hyperfy V2 on hyperfy.how? (asked by treed) A: Yes, plus some additional content in Discord and linked resources (answered by Saori and Omka)
Q: Will we eventually hook in VRM arms with controllers or hand tracking? (asked by TheMattEmpire) A: Unanswered

# Discord Chat Analysis: ðŸ§Šâ”‚3d-design

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily focused on 3D design techniques and Hyperfy platform features. ~/HowiEDuhzit announced an update to support LOD (Level of Detail) functionality, allowing meshes named in the format objectLOD0, objLOD1, etc., as well as custom colliders with objCOL. TheMattEmpire shared insights about character rigging, topology, and VRM exports from Blender, including a Twitch stream demonstrating the process. The conversation explored optimization techniques like LODs, with TheMattEmpire noting how different LOD configurations affect silhouettes at distance and how object size should determine LOD distances. There were discussions about asset organization, including parenting objects, standardizing "sockets" for attachments, and optimizing materials to reduce draw calls. ~/HowiEDuhzit also created a Hyperfy theme for Blender with a default startup file that includes Hyperfy's default terrain and HDR for better in-world previewing. Other topics included potential features like grouping apps together, multi-selecting elements in a dev mode, and saving assembled structures as single optimized assets.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Do assets auto disappear if they have no LODs? (asked by TheMattEmpire) A: Unanswered
Q: Can we group apps together yet? (asked by devilsadvocate.sol) A: Unanswered
Q: Do people think the rotation of an asset such as a road should be from the centre, or from the corner? (asked by TheMattEmpire) A: I would assume the center center. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Why are GLB animations not showing up in world? (asked by fractilians) A: v2 doesn't support glb animations yet (answered by Saori)
